The electrical connection between the cells can be made when the cells are in the casing. To avoid leakage from the cells or from the resulting module, no blunt tooling shall be used. The cells and the resulting module form can be external short circuited. Precautions to avoid this shall be taken: covering one current connector of a cell but also of the module once all cells are connected.

To avoid decrease the severity of injuries caused by electrical short circuit or leakage, safety gloves and glasses shall be used.

When connections are soldered, precautions shall be implemented to ensure sufficient solder flux activation to avoid incomplete solder connections.

During ultrasonic welding and other operations, no damage to cell container and critical cell design elements may occur. Precautions shall be taken to avoid this.

Samples from the tab welding station shall be taken and subjected to a pull test.

A general risk of a battery module is the thermal runaway. This can be introduced by electrical and mechanical abuse. It is therefore necessary to avoid any abuse during the module assembling. Another recommendation is to monitor the temperature of the modules on regular base. ... To avoid the propagation of a thermal runaway the modules can whenever possible be placed in a moulded tray.
